**Background:**  A syndemic consists of interacting epidemics producing an excess burden in a population due to harmful social condition. It has been successfully applied to the health of MSM since 2003 but the field lacks consensus on which conditions would constitute a syndemic among MSM. Furthermore, transgender MSM are nearly always omitted from syndemic research on MSM. In order to develop a research project tailored the need of MSM in French-speaking belgium, we have conducted a Delphi study to gain insight on their main health concerns. 
\ 
**Methods:** From September 2022, we have recruited cisgender and transgender members from LGBTQIA organizations in French-speaking Belgium. Experts were selected based on their lived experience and expertise in community-led organizations. The Delphi study consisted in three rounds designed to (1) elicit ideas on psychological, social and physical issues and their interactions ; (2) select the most relevant issues and ; (3) rank them by pertinence.  
\
**Results:** `r .N_cis` cisgender experts and `r .N_trans` transgender experts have participated.
